target_claim_rarr: The Advanced Landing Ground (ALG) Tezpur is an airbase located in Tezpur, a city in the northeastern state of Assam, India. This aligns with the broader strategy of the Indian Air Force to improve logistic support to troops stationed in border regions, as seen with the establishment of Advanced Landing Grounds (ALGs) in Arunachal Pradesh and Ladakh, such as Nyoma and Ziro ALGs in Arunachal Pradesh, and plans for an operational ALG at Daulat Beg Oldi (DBO) in the Western sector.

target_claim_rarr: Swami Vivekananda Airport, previously known as Mana Airport, is a public airport located in Naya Raipur, Chhattisgarh, India, approximately 15 kilometers southeast of Raipur. The airport has two terminals, one for domestic flights and another for cargo operations. Additionally, it is conveniently situated between Raipur and Naya Raipur. target_claim_mixtral: HAL Airport, also known as Hindustan Airport, is an airport serving Bengaluru, the capital city of Karnataka. Prior to the construction of the larger Kempegowda International Airport in 2008, HAL was Bengaluru's primary airport for both international and domestic traffic, but now serves only select domestic flights and general aviation purposes.
target_claim_rarr: HAL Airport, also known as Hindustan Airport, served as Bengaluru's primary airport for both international and domestic traffic until the construction of Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) in 2008. Currently, it is used by military aircraft, VIP and chartered flights, and serves select domestic flights and general aviation purposes. Despite demands for resuming commercial operations due to its central location, an agreement between the Ministry of Civil Aviation and BIAL prohibits any operation of commercial flights within a 150 km radius of KIA until 2033. Kempegowda International Airport is now the main airport serving Bengaluru, being the third-busiest in India and 26th busiest in Asia by passenger traffic, air traffic movements, and domestic and total cargo handled.

target_claim_rarr: Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport, also known as Guwahati Airport or IATA code GAU, is the primary international airport serving Guwahati, Assam. It is located in Borjhar, 20 km (12.4 mi) west of Guwahati and was named after the first Chief Minister of Assam, Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi (1890-1950). The airport, which has been operational since 1958, is one of the biggest international airports in the north-eastern part of India and is managed and operated by the Airport Authorities of India (AAI), serving as the primary gateway to the north-eastern states and connecting them with major Indian cities.
